intro: Moldenhawera polysperma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and the ability to produce multiple flower buds from a single stem. Moldenhawera polysperma is widely cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
